intro: Genista borysthenica, commonly known as the Crimean broom, is a perennial shrub native to the steppes of southern Russia and Ukraine. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, often branching stems covered in fine hairs. Its yellow flowers, which appear in late spring, are clustered in racemes and attract various pollinators. The plant is well adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along riverbanks.
